noun.description: A low-melting alloy, especially one based on lead and tin or (for higher temperatures) on brass or silver, used for joining less fusible metals.
examples: remove the fitting using a blowtorch to melt the solder
the Roman silversmith did indeed use several different solders
the wires to this clip are soldered to the circuit board

origin: Middle English: from Old French soudure, from the verb souder, from Latin solidare fasten together, from solidus solid.
